title.narrative: 4.1 STRENGTHENED EVIDENCE & CAPACITY TOENSURE Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) POLICY IMPLEMENTATION

description.narrative: 4.1 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) authorities have strengthened evidence and capacity to ensure policy implementation and coordination, which contributes to Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more Palestinian children and families, especially the most vulnerable, have access to and use affordable, sustainable and safely managed water and sanitation services, and adopt improved hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 WASH authorities have strengthened evidence and capacity to ensure policy implementation and coordination

description.narrative: UNICEF has supported the WASH sector and cluster enabling environment to increase accountability through strengthening the capacity and systems of national WASH authorities and to enable different actors to contribute effectively to the WASH sector. Intervention included for coordination, innovation and sector planning. For example national sector coordination mechanisms have been strengthened, including the humanitarian country cluster coordination and the sub-cluster in Gaza. Special support to the PWA has been provided for Water and Sanitation Safety Planning, including for the sanitation sector in Gaza and Innovations workshops at the national level. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: PWA leading core functions of the WASH cluster

actual.value: 2019:Considering all the changes in the context and the current situation, it is no longer appropriate to keep the PWA leading the WASH Cluster. In agreement with the PWA and the Humanitarian Coordination, UNICEF decided to reverse the transition and take the lead again in 2020.

title.narrative: Standards for WASH in health facilities in Gaza drafted

actual.value: 2020:There is a gap in the data related to the conditions of WASH facilities in health centers. Therefore, WASH with the coordination of health colleagues has completed the WASH assessment and Surveillance system in health institutions in Gaza (2019), and completed in centers in WB. Preparations are und

title.narrative: Existence of functioning cluster coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene in humanitarian situations

baseline.value: PWA leading 1 core functions of the WASH Cluster

target.value: 2022:PWA leading 3 core functions of the WASH Cluster

actual.value: 2020:As of 2020 the WASH cluster coordination is lead under UNICEF. in 2020 UNICEF has lead the WASH Cluster WASH COVID-19 response plan. 7 assessments in WB & Gaza Monitoring the availability, quality & prices of the WASH-related items & goods.
